title: Long John Silver’s “Talk Like a Pirate Day” Reels in the Silver

Thu, Sep 24, 2015, 15:31 BST - UK Markets close in 59 mins. Long John Silver’s “Talk Like a Pirate Day” Reels in the Silver Consumers Respond to Fun Promotion Press Release : Long John Silver’s – 16 minutes ago Print 
LOUISVILLE, Ky.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- 
Long John Silver’s restaurants reeled in the pirate’s silver after Saturday’s Talk Like a Pirate Day promotion at Long John Silver’s restaurants nationwide. Both sales and transactions were up at participating restaurants with many locations showing double digit increases. 
“Talk Like a Pirate Day is a fun event for our restaurants and our customers,” said Margo Mize, Senior Vice President of Marketing for LJS. “Our performance also underscores consumers’ affection for and connection with the Long John Silver’s brand.” 
Consumers who talked like a pirate on Sept. 19 at any participating Long John Silver’s restaurant received a free fish tender while customers who dressed like a pirate received a free 2-piece fish tender basket. 
Crews and customers took the promotion to heart and dressed the part from coast to coast. Photos can be seen at the LJS facebook page ( https://www.facebook.com/LongJohnSilvers/photos_stream ). LJS pirates could also be found roaming Times Square and appearing in the crowd at The Today Show. 
About Long John Silver’s 
Long John Silver’s is a classic American brand founded in 1969, and stands today as the nation’s largest quick-service seafood chain with more than 1,100 franchised restaurants in the U.S. and Asia. Long John Silver’s is famous for its pure, wild-caught Alaskan whitefish that’s hand dipped in the restaurant and cooked to golden perfection. All wild-caught fish served at Long John Silver’s is sourced from a U.S. fishery that has been certified as sustainable by the Marine Stewardship Council since 2005 and certified as responsibly managed under the Global Trust/ASMI FAO-based standards.
